Right Click Door/Pair Door/False Front Section View   
 -   
 Section Face
image180.gif
image2038.gif
image1290.gif

In addition to the  standard 
 six  right click Opening options you get the Properties option. The 
 Properties option for a Door has 3 possible tabs:
Door Tab
image1006.gif
There are 2 possible options on the Door Tab:

Type 
	 -   Will allow you to select the Door level to use on Tall 
	 Cabinets. 
 Change 
	 -  Will bring up the  Door 
	 Style  selector and allow you to change the Door Style for the 
	 selected Door. 
 Preserve Material -  If the selected 
	 Door's Material has been overridden then the Preserve Material option 
	 is available. Selecting this will keep the Material from changing 
	 to something else "preserving" the Material when the Assembly 
	 is Saved to your Catalog.

Type 
	 -   Will allow you to select the Door level to use on Tall 
	 Cabinets.

Type 
	 -   Will allow you to select the Door level to use on Tall 
	 Cabinets.

Change 
	 -  Will bring up the  Door 
	 Style  selector and allow you to change the Door Style for the 
	 selected Door.

Change 
	 -  Will bring up the  Door 
	 Style  selector and allow you to change the Door Style for the 
	 selected Door.

Preserve Material -  If the selected 
	 Door's Material has been overridden then the Preserve Material option 
	 is available. Selecting this will keep the Material from changing 
	 to something else "preserving" the Material when the Assembly 
	 is Saved to your Catalog.

Preserve Material -  If the selected 
	 Door's Material has been overridden then the Preserve Material option 
	 is available. Selecting this will keep the Material from changing 
	 to something else "preserving" the Material when the Assembly 
	 is Saved to your Catalog.
Hinges Tab
image941.gif
There are 6 options on the Hinges Tab:

Change 
	 -  Will bring up the Hinge selector and allow you to change 
	 the Hinge for the selected Door. 
 Minimum 
	 Distance from Door Top -  Allows you to specify a different 
	 distance for the Hinge from the Top of the selected Door. The default 
	 value comes from the selected Hinges specifications in the Material 
	 Catalog. 
 Minimum 
	 Distance from Door Bottom -  Allows you to specify a different 
	 distance for the Hinge from the Bottom of the selected Door. The default 
	 value comes from the selected Hinges specifications in the Material 
	 Catalog. 
 Quantity 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Quantity of Hinges on the selected 
	 Door. 
 Create 
	 Cup Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Hinge 
	 Cup and Anchor holes are machined on the selected Door. 
 Create 
	 Plate Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Hinge 
	 Plate Holes are machined on the associated Part for the selected Door.

Change 
	 -  Will bring up the Hinge selector and allow you to change 
	 the Hinge for the selected Door.

Change 
	 -  Will bring up the Hinge selector and allow you to change 
	 the Hinge for the selected Door.

Minimum 
	 Distance from Door Top -  Allows you to specify a different 
	 distance for the Hinge from the Top of the selected Door. The default 
	 value comes from the selected Hinges specifications in the Material 
	 Catalog.

Minimum 
	 Distance from Door Top -  Allows you to specify a different 
	 distance for the Hinge from the Top of the selected Door. The default 
	 value comes from the selected Hinges specifications in the Material 
	 Catalog.

Minimum 
	 Distance from Door Bottom -  Allows you to specify a different 
	 distance for the Hinge from the Bottom of the selected Door. The default 
	 value comes from the selected Hinges specifications in the Material 
	 Catalog.

Minimum 
	 Distance from Door Bottom -  Allows you to specify a different 
	 distance for the Hinge from the Bottom of the selected Door. The default 
	 value comes from the selected Hinges specifications in the Material 
	 Catalog.

Quantity 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Quantity of Hinges on the selected 
	 Door.

Quantity 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Quantity of Hinges on the selected 
	 Door.

Create 
	 Cup Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Hinge 
	 Cup and Anchor holes are machined on the selected Door.

Create 
	 Cup Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Hinge 
	 Cup and Anchor holes are machined on the selected Door.

Create 
	 Plate Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Hinge 
	 Plate Holes are machined on the associated Part for the selected Door.

Create 
	 Plate Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Hinge 
	 Plate Holes are machined on the associated Part for the selected Door.
Pulls Tab
image942.gif
There are 7 options on the Hinges Tab:

Change 
	 -  Will bring up the Pull selector and allow you to change the 
	 Pull for the selected Door. 
 Reference 
	 -  Allows you to specify where the Pulls position is referenced 
	 from on the selected Door. (Top, Center, or Bottom)

Change 
	 -  Will bring up the Pull selector and allow you to change the 
	 Pull for the selected Door.

Change 
	 -  Will bring up the Pull selector and allow you to change the 
	 Pull for the selected Door.
image1294.gif

Horizontal 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Pulls Horizontal Position from 
	 the selected Reference on the selected Door. 
 Vertical 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Pulls Vertical Position from the 
	 selected Reference on the selected Door. 
 Quantity 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Quantity of Pulls on the selected 
	 Door. The valid range is between 0 and 3. 
 Rotate 
	 Pull -  Will Rotate the Pull on the selected Door 90 degrees. 
 Create 
	 Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Pull holes 
	 are machined on the selected Door.

Horizontal 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Pulls Horizontal Position from 
	 the selected Reference on the selected Door.

Horizontal 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Pulls Horizontal Position from 
	 the selected Reference on the selected Door.

Vertical 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Pulls Vertical Position from the 
	 selected Reference on the selected Door.

Vertical 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Pulls Vertical Position from the 
	 selected Reference on the selected Door.

Quantity 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Quantity of Pulls on the selected 
	 Door. The valid range is between 0 and 3.

Quantity 
	 -  Allows you to specify the Quantity of Pulls on the selected 
	 Door. The valid range is between 0 and 3.

Rotate 
	 Pull -  Will Rotate the Pull on the selected Door 90 degrees.

Rotate 
	 Pull -  Will Rotate the Pull on the selected Door 90 degrees.

Create 
	 Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Pull holes 
	 are machined on the selected Door.

Create 
	 Holes -  Allows you to specify whether or not the Pull holes 
	 are machined on the selected Door.
Sub-Frame Tab -
S2M.jpg
image943.gif
There are 6 options on the Sub-Frame tab:

Add 
	 Sub-Frame -  Turns the selected Door/Opening into a Sub-Frame. 
 Frame 
	 Recess -  Specifies the amount the Sub-Frame recesses in the 
	 selected Opening. 
 Top 
	 Rail -  Specifies the Width of the Sub-Frames  Top 
	 Rail . 
 Bottom 
	 Rail -  Specifies the Width of the Sub-Frames  Bottom 
	 Rail . 
 Left 
	 Stile   -  Specifies the Width of the 
	 Sub-Frames  Left 
	 Stile . 
 Right 
	 Stile -  Specifies the Width of the Sub-Frames  Right 
	 Stile .

Add

	 selected Opening.
